input2:
The patient is a ___ speaking only ___ yo woman followed by Dr. ___ in clinic), and subsequent seizures who presents as a code stroke. 

Per the granddaughter at the bedside she was last known well this morning at around 7:30am. She was sitting in the shower and her daughter was helping her bathe herself when she developed sudden onset LT facial droop, LT sided weakness. Her daughter called EMS who transported her to the ED. Initially was responsive to questions which was not the case on arrival. The patient had an NIHSS as above scoring for LOC, commands, language, and antigravity. She was not unable to exchange information.  

Neurologic and General review od systems unable to obtain aspatient apahsic

input4: No family history of strokes or heart disease.
input5:
General:  ill appearing 
HEENT: NCAT, copious secretions in her mouth  
___: RRR
Pulmonary: CTAB
Abdomen: Soft
Extremities: Warm, no edema

Neurologic Examination:
- Mental Status - Initially Awake, and echolalic which
deteriorated into obtounded. 

- Cranial Nerves - PERRL 2->1.5 brisk. Corneals present
bilaterally. No clear BTT. Gag +. LT NLFF.

- Motor - no temor or asterixix moves all extremities
spontaneously antigravity but RT > LT. Withdraws to noxios stimulation on all extremities.

-DTRs:
  Bi Tri ___ Pat Ach
L  1  1    1    1   1
R  1  1    1    1   1
Plantar response extensor LT.
DISCHARGE PHYSICAL EXAMINATION :
Largely unchanged from admision examination. She developed subsequent left arm shaking consistent likely with partial seizure from cortical irritation from hemorrhage.
input6:
IMAGING: 
NON CONTRAST HEAD CT:
1.  Large mixed attenuation intraparenchymal hemorrhage 
involving the medial right frontal lobe with subarachnoid extension along the cingulate sulcus, tracking posteriorly into the region of the posterior corpus callosum. Subarachnoid hemorrhage in in the adjacent bilateral frontal gyri.  The hemorrhage measures up to 5.1 cm superiorly and 2.9 cm inferiorly.  There is associated 8 mm leftward shift of normally midline structures. 
2.  Smaller right frontal intraparenchymal hemorrhage measures 1.3 cm. 
3.  The basilar cisterns remain patent at this time. 
4.  Mild asymmetry of the left lateral ventricle temporal horn.  Close attention on followup examination is recommended to exclude developing hydrocephalus.
